content: quote: Originally posted by badmac933: I say knock down every missle North Korea launches, no matter where it's headed or for what reason. They like "posturing", we'll show them posturing! The problem with that theory is that you have a system that is good enough to score a high percentage of hits. If we shoot & miss, we will be embarrassed, the DPRK will have a propaganda victory and might be encouraged to launch more missiles, if not start an all-out war because we gave them a casus belli without intimidating them.

To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean.

content: quote: Originally posted by badmac933: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. So you're saying that the South Koreans are not aware of the 28,500 military personnel helping protect their counrty? Of course they are aware of that. But they are also aware that they have 48 million Korean civilians to worry about, a quarter of which are in/around Seoul. Should we decide to pack up our troops tomorrow, the Koreans will still be there. If anyone should make the call as to when & if we go to war with the DPRK, it should be them, because the ROK has far more at stake than we do.

content: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: quote: Originally posted by SUNLINER81: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: South Koreans must be reassured from hearing all of this nonsense, especially those who live in Seoul....After all, North Korea has more artillary aimed at that city than any other place on earth.. Seoul is only 12 miles from the DMZ. The ROK has always been cautious about reacting to DPRK provocations because of that. To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. This is a case of defending Japan and the United States and anyone in the range of the despots missiles... Personally, I think that the missile will be tracked and if it's flight path is over Japan or it appears headed towards U.S. territory or both, it may just be shot down... The DPRK is about broke, it's people are starving and may well be on it's last legs... It's major strength is it's army and it may be reaching a point of "use it or loose it" and this may be a deliberate provocation by the DPRK, so that they will have an excuse, in at least their minds, to use it... If it comes to another confrontation and I honestly hope not, I hope the Korean people and the American people have the will and the where with all to fight it to a final conclusion. I have not been to South Korea and only know what I read about the situation... I defer to others, who have the experience on the subject... Respectfully, SUNLINER81

The US won't do a damn thing, NK will storm Seoul, destroy it, then hold japan hostage with a nuclear weapon...(You DO remember they have them right?) Just a bunch of stupid nonsense...shoot the missle down, LOL... Uh, sure... If ya say so... Respectfully, SUNLINER81 This is a long-standing concern of the ROK, because they know they will be mostly the ones that have to live (or die) with the consequences of our actions. Seoul is only 12 miles from the DMZ. The ROK has always been cautious about reacting to DPRK provocations because of that. To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean.
quote: Originally posted by SUNLINER81: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: South Koreans must be reassured from hearing all of this nonsense, especially those who live in Seoul....After all, North Korea has more artillary aimed at that city than any other place on earth.. The US won't do a damn thing, NK will storm Seoul, destroy it, then hold japan hostage with a nuclear weapon...(You DO remember they have them right?) Just a bunch of stupid nonsense...shoot the missle down, LOL... Uh, sure... If ya say so... Respectfully, SUNLINER81
reply: This is a long-standing concern of the ROK, because they know they will be mostly the ones that have to live (or die) with the consequences of our actions. Seoul is only 12 miles from the DMZ. The ROK has always been cautious about reacting to DPRK provocations because of that. To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean.

content: quote: Originally posted by badmac933: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. So you're saying that the South Koreans are not aware of the 28,500 military personnel helping protect their counrty? 28,500 pin cushions that will valiantly die during a million man assault....The only mission for them is to slow down the North Korean army...not win. We just don't have the force we did during World War II....we have to live with the fact that until we do, we can't bully everybody especially the North Koreans..
quote: Originally posted by badmac933: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. We just don't have the force we did during World War II....we have to live with the fact that until we do, we can't bully everybody especially the North Koreans..
title: Military Ready to Shoot Down NKorean Missile

content: quote: Originally posted by badmac933: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. So you're saying that the South Koreans are not aware of the 28,500 military personnel helping protect their counrty? Of course they are aware of that. But they are also aware that they have 48 million Korean civilians to worry about, a quarter of which are in/around Seoul. Should we decide to pack up our troops tomorrow, the Koreans will still be there. If anyone should make the call as to when & if we go to war with the DPRK, it should be them, because the ROK has far more at stake than we do.
quote: Originally posted by badmac933: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. So you're saying that the South Koreans are not aware of the 28,500 military personnel helping protect their counrty?
reply: Of course they are aware of that. But they are also aware that they have 48 million Korean civilians to worry about, a quarter of which are in/around Seoul. Should we decide to pack up our troops tomorrow, the Koreans will still be there. If anyone should make the call as to when & if we go to war with the DPRK, it should be them, because the ROK has far more at stake than we do.
title: Military Ready to Shoot Down NKorean Missile

content: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: quote: Originally posted by SUNLINER81: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: South Koreans must be reassured from hearing all of this nonsense, especially those who live in Seoul....After all, North Korea has more artillary aimed at that city than any other place on earth.. The US won't do a damn thing, NK will storm Seoul, destroy it, then hold japan hostage with a nuclear weapon...(You DO remember they have them right?) Just a bunch of stupid nonsense...shoot the missle down, LOL... Uh, sure... If ya say so... Respectfully, SUNLINER81 This is a long-standing concern of the ROK, because they know they will be mostly the ones that have to live (or die) with the consequences of our actions. Seoul is only 12 miles from the DMZ. The ROK has always been cautious about reacting to DPRK provocations because of that. To put it another way, the South Koreans are not terribly happy when people here start talking about defending America to the last Korean. This is a case of defending Japan and the United States and anyone in the range of the despots missiles... Personally, I think that the missile will be tracked and if it's flight path is over Japan or it appears headed towards U.S. territory or both, it may just be shot down... The DPRK is about broke, it's people are starving and may well be on it's last legs... It's major strength is it's army and it may be reaching a point of "use it or loose it" and this may be a deliberate provocation by the DPRK, so that they will have an excuse, in at least their minds, to use it... If it comes to another confrontation and I honestly hope not, I hope the Korean people and the American people have the will and the where with all to fight it to a final conclusion. I have not been to South Korea and only know what I read about the situation... I defer to others, who have the experience on the subject... Respectfully, SUNLINER81

The DPRK is about broke, it's people are starving and may well be on it's last legs... It's major strength is it's army and it may be reaching a point of "use it or loose it" and this may be a deliberate provocation by the DPRK, so that they will have an excuse, in at least their minds, to use it... If it comes to another confrontation and I honestly hope not, I hope the Korean people and the American people have the will and the where with all to fight it to a final conclusion. content: Unless North Korea destroys an American city.....this Nation has ZERO desire for another conflict, even if NK starts to publically execute babies in mass.
